channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Car badly damaged and abandoned in private parking area., 14th August
item.description:
This car has been abandoned here for many months now. It is in a private parking zone which regularly gets filled up, it is unpleasant to look at, and most importantly has many dangerous parts on it that could cause harm to the kids plaiying outside in the area. Needs removing urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belcroft Close, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp post outside Number 8 not illuminating, 14th August
item.description:
Light not working
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, St Johns Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London

item.title: Fly tipping on Amherst Drive near house number 8, 14th August
item.description:
A shopping trolley full of large household waste / construction waste left on the road (not pavement) in front of my car on 8 Amherst Drive by a group of 5 men in an unmarked white van.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Amherst Drive, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree pulled completely down and blocking pavement, 14th August
item.description:
Tree pulled down and broken in half. Blocking entire width of paved walkway and residents having to walk on grass verge or road. Not doable for pushchairs or elderly. Needs removing as a matter of urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belcroft Close, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving stones broken again, 14th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Allenswood Road, Well Hall, London

item.title: Old tarmac repair needs replacing, 14th August
item.description:
There were temporary repairs made to the pavement area when the old tree was removed. These repairs were done using tarmac. The tarmac is breaking up and it is very uneven. It represents a hazard to pedestrians. It also looks awful now. These need replacing with standard concrete paving slabs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melbury Close, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown, Downham, London

item.title: Old tree stump and roots exposed, 14th August
item.description:
The stump of the tree that was felled a few years ago and parts of the old root system are exposed - see attached photos. They represent a clear hazard to pedestrians - particularly children and the elderly. Could you please come and remove the stump and exposed roots?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melbury Close, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish from local restaurants, 14th August
item.description:
Local restaurants are dumping hard rubbish. Its been like this for 2 weeks, with more items added every couple of days.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Standard Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not enough bins. Multiple businesses and homes., 14th August
item.description:
Been ongoing for many years. I keep reporting the problem to the landlord. There is flytipping but also not enough bins for the commercial businesses and residents. There is now a food business and a childrens centre so its a public health issue

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Timberwharf Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
